title: Allen devastated, but loss not on QB, Bills say
content: After another playoff loss that ended a promising season for the Bills, quarterback Josh Allen told reporters that "I feel like I let my teammates down tonight," though Buffalo players and coaches disagreed after the Broncos won 33-30 on Saturday night.

title: Bills' McDermott rips refs' ruling on pivotal INT

content: Venus Williams became the oldest player to compete in singles at the Australian Open, but faltered late in a three-set loss to Olga Danilovic.

content: Less than a week after blowing a big early lead in a loss to Minnesota, the Spurs held on for the win Saturday despite a 55-point effort from Anthony Edwards.

title: "Your Future Will Be Over": Kapil Sibal's Warning To BJP Allies

title: 'Rs 3,000 Per Plot, Papers Taken': Manipur's Displaced Tribals Seek Answers From Civil Group ITLF
content: Members of tribal communities who left Manipur's capital Imphal after Meitei-Kuki ethnic violence broke out in May 2023 have asked a civil society organisation of the Kuki tribes to give details of money and documents it has taken from them.

title: Woman, 22, Dies By Suicide After Husband Says No To Buying Phone: Cops
content: A heartbreaking incident has come to light from the Aravalli district of Gujarat, where a impulse decision broke a family. A 22-year-old migrant woman allegedly took her own life following a dispute with her husband over a mobile phone.

title: Woman Cop Honoured With Railways' Top Award For Rescuing Over 150 Children

title: UP Man Attacks Sisters With Knife For Resisting Harassment

title: Assam Won't Bow Before Pak Agent: Himanta Sarma's Veiled Dig at Gaurav Gogoi

title: Massive blaze at Karachi mall: Firefighter among six killed, many feared trapped - video
content: A massive fire ripped through Karachi's Gul Plaza shopping mall late Saturday, killing at least six people, including a firefighter. Rescue operations continued into Sunday as many were feared trapped inside the complex, which suffered severe structural damage. The blaze, suspected to be caused by a short circuit, has reignited concerns over fire safety standards in the city.

title: 'Bengal ready to topple TMC's maha jungle raj': PM Modi rips into Mamata govt; watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a rally in Singur, West Bengal, urged voters to end the 15-year "mega-jungleraj" of the Mamata Banerjee government. He launched development projects worth over Rs 830 crore and flagged off three Amrit Bharat trains. Modi accused the state government of obstructing central schemes and highlighted West Bengal's potential for development.

title: 'Beautiful woman distracts...': Congress MLA ‚Äòrape‚Äô theory remark sparks row
content: Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya sparked outrage with remarks suggesting rape can follow seeing a beautiful woman and that SC/ST/OBC women are raped due to scriptural interpretations. Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav demanded an apology from Rahul Gandhi, while the Congress distanced itself, calling Baraiya's views personal.

title: ‚ÄòCautious approach‚Äô: After marker row, SEC to revert to bottled indelible ink
content: Following controversy over erasable marker pens in recent municipal polls, the State Election Commission will revert to traditional bottled indelible ink for upcoming local body elections. This cautious approach aims to prevent bogus voting after viral videos showed ink marks being easily removed, sparking widespread criticism and demands for action.

title: Who is Nickolay Mladenov? Man at center of Gaza 'board of peace'
content: Nickolay Mladenov, a Bulgarian diplomat and former UN envoy, has been named High Representative for Gaza. He will work to turn a fragile US-backed ceasefire into lasting peace, linking the US, Israel, and Palestinian authorities.

title: MP: Speeding car mows down labourers; 2 killed, 11 hurt in Jabalpur
content: A speeding, unplated car mowed down labourers during their lunch break, killing two and injuring eleven in Jabalpur on Sunaday. The victims, from Mandla district, were installing road dividers when the horrific incident occurred near Ekta Chowk. Authorities are actively searching for the driver who fled the scene, with one injured person in critical condition.

title: 'Why are Americans paying?' Trump aide Navarro targets India again; AI in crosshair
content: Donald Trump's trade adviser Peter Navarro has criticized India, questioning why Americans pay for AI services hosted in the US but used by Indian users. This comes amid ongoing trade tensions, including US tariffs on Indian imports and Navarro's past criticisms of India's Russian oil purchases and trade practices.

title: Daryl Mitchell scripts history; makes this record
content: Daryl Mitchell proved a challenge for India in ODIs. His century helped New Zealand post 338. Mitchell's record against India is impressive. He leads in average runs against them. New Zealand's innings saw Mitchell and Glenn Phillips score centuries. This partnership was crucial. India's bowlers took wickets late in the innings. New Zealand finished at 337 for 8.

title: Goldman Sachs AI job impact: Analysts see 6-7% jobs displaced; new roles expected
content: Goldman Sachs analysts foresee AI automating a quarter of work hours, potentially displacing 6-7% of jobs. While this signals significant labor shifts, a complete employment crisis is unlikely. Historically, technological advancements have spurred new occupations, suggesting AI will also create unforeseen roles, similar to how frozen foods reshaped the workforce.

title: Budget 2026: MAIT seeks customs duty cuts on key electronic components
content: The IT industry body MAIT has urged the government to slash basic customs duty on key electronic components and boost tax incentives in the upcoming Union Budget. This move aims to strengthen domestic manufacturing, improve global competitiveness, and address supply chain vulnerabilities amid rising global uncertainties. MAIT also called for continued support for mobile manufacturing.

title: Amrit Bharat Express expands: PM Modi flags off 3 trains in Assam, Bengal; 2 more lined up
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be inaugrating five new Amrit Bharat Express trains, expanding India's long-distance rail network. These new services aim to enhance travel experience and connectivity for the common man, with key routes connecting various regions including the North-East, North India, and South India.

title: Riding cycles of over Rs 10 lakh, India braces for historic chapter with Pune Grand Tour 2026
content: India enters a new era in professional cycling with the inaugural Pune Grand Tour, the country‚Äôs first UCI 2.2 multi-stage road race. Featuring 171 riders from 35 countries, it is scheduled from January 19 to 23. The five-day event puts India on the global professional cycling map.

title: ‚ÄòHe was screaming for help‚Äô: Techie drowns as car falls into pit in Noida; here‚Äôs what happened
content: In a heartbreaking incident, a software developer lost his life when his SUV plunged into a flooded construction pit in Noida. After crashing through a compromised wall, he desperately attempted to remain on the vehicle's roof, calling for help. However, thick fog obscured visibility, and the delayed response of rescue teams resulted in tragic consequences.

title: Smith reveals truth behind Babar Azam 'tantrum' claims as BBL drama erupts
content: Steve Smith has dismissed reports of a rift with teammate Babar Azam, clarifying a on-field decision during their Big Bash League match. Smith explained his tactical choice to prioritize a strong Power Surge over a single, which led to his explosive century.  The pair were later seen chatting casually, with Smith confirming their good relationship.

title: Govinda finally addresses speculation about his marriage to Sunita Ahuja
content: Govinda breaks silence on marriage split rumours with Sunita Ahuja, alleging a "big conspiracy" manipulates family. He calls silence "weakness," prays for no misunderstandings, and notes career struggles since 1987 marriage. Kids Tina (2015 debut) and Yashvardhan prep for films.

title: Hotel politics returns to Mumbai: Mahayuti‚Äôs musical chairs over mayor after BMC win
content: The BJP, which emerged as the single largest party with 89 seats in the 227-member House, still falls short of electing a mayor on its own and depends on the Shinde-led Shiv Sena to cross the halfway mark of 114. Together, the allies command 118 seats, but the question of who controls the mayor‚Äôs chair, and for how long, remains unresolved.

title: One bar of signal, miles from home: Indian students stranded in Iran; curfew hinders communication
content: Indian students in Iran, particularly near the Iraq border, struggled with internet shutdowns and curfews, relying on sporadic signals to contact anxious families. While some returned due to uncertainty, others remain, reporting campus safety despite the unrest. The situation highlights communication challenges and parental concerns

title: What's wrong with Labubu? Workers at Chinese factory exploited; long work & low pay
content: A report by China Labor Watch revealed exploitative practices at a factory producing popular Labubus dolls for Pop Mart. The factory allegedly hired underage workers without proper protections and forced employees to sign blank contracts. Workers also faced unrealistic production targets and excessive overtime, exceeding legal limits significantly.

title: Budget 2026 outlook: ICRA flags focus on debt consolidation; capex push to continue
content: Ahead of the 2026-27 Union Budget, ICRA anticipates a dual focus on medium-term debt reduction and robust capital expenditure. The budget, aligning with the 16th Finance Commission, aims for a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP. Significant infrastructure spending is expected, with capital expenditure projected to rise by 14% to Rs 13.1 trillion, before potential fiscal pressures emerge.

title: Top US investor warns Google and Microsoft; says trillions are being wasted on AI
content: Renowned investor Michael Burry, famous for predicting the 2008 crash, warns of an AI bubble. He believes tech giants are investing trillions in infrastructure and tools that may not yield lasting returns, likening it to a costly, unnecessary upgrade. Burry cautions that the real economy's utilization is unclear, potentially leading to stagnant tech employment and a long downturn.

title: Biz sentiment: CII-BCI rises for 3rd straight quarter to 66.5; firms upbeat on outlook
content: Indian businesses are feeling more optimistic, with the CII Business Confidence Index hitting a five-quarter high. Strong domestic demand, boosted by GST cuts and festive spending, is driving this positive outlook. Firms anticipate further demand growth and robust investment and hiring intentions, signaling continued economic momentum.

title: Haryana ends age relaxation; makes 6 years mandatory for Class 1 from 2026‚Äì27 session
content: Haryana has ended age relaxation for Class 1 admissions, making completion of six years mandatory from the 2026‚Äì27 academic session in line with the National Education Policy 2020 and Punjab and Haryana high court directions. The move follows amendments to the Haryana Right to Education Rules, 2011. Children below the cut-off will be placed in Balvatika or pre-primary classes, while private schools in Gurgaon outline limited seat availability and structured admission processes.

title: Iran protests: At least 5,000 killed; Trump, Khamenei draw swords - top developments
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has acknowledged thousands of deaths during recent nationwide protests, a rare admission amid a harsh crackdown. Khamenei blamed the United States and foreign actors for orchestrating the unrest, which began over economic issues but evolved into anti-regime demonstrations. US President Donald Trump condemned the violence and called for new leadership in Iran.

title: IND vs NZ: Jadeja turns flying eagle to dismiss Young ‚Äî Watch
content: Ravindra Jadeja produced a sensational flying catch at backward point to dismiss Will Young in the third ODI, swinging momentum India‚Äôs way. Diving sharply to his right off Harshit Rana‚Äôs bowling, Jadeja ended a key partnership and stunned fans. The moment went viral, highlighting Jadeja‚Äôs elite fielding and game-changing impact.

title: Greenland row: Trump rattles EU with tariff threats ‚Äî why India should take note for US trade deal
content: Trump‚Äôs move to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland underscores how trade measures can be wielded as political tools, regardless of partnerships or agreements. For India, the message is clear: trade deals cannot substitute for strategic autonomy, which must remain non-negotiable.

title: Now, Trump tariffs Europe over Greenland: And the winner is China‚Äîexplained
content: Trump's threat to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland has reignited debate on his tariff strategy.  These tariffs are increasingly seen as harming US jobs, keeping inflation high, straining alliances, and failing to curb China's exports, despite revenue gains.

title: ‚ÄòBomb on board‚Äô: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing; message written on toilet paper triggers alert
content: A Delhi to Bagdogra flight made an emergency landing in Lucknow on Sunday. This happened after a bomb threat was reported. A message claiming a bomb was on board was found in the aircraft's toilet. The flight carried 238 passengers and crew. Security agencies are conducting a thorough search of the aircraft in Lucknow.

title: Ball girl collapses; match stopped at Australian Open ‚Äî Watch
content: A ball girl's collapse due to heat briefly halted an Australian Open match, with players Zeynep Sonmez and Ekaterina Alexandrova offering immediate assistance. Despite the interruption and rising temperatures, Sonmez secured a significant career victory. This incident highlights the challenges of extreme weather at the tournament, with further heat expected.

title: Market recap: Mcap of 3 of top-10 most valued firms jumps by Rs 75,855 cr
content: Despite a flat broader market, State Bank of India and Infosys propelled a Rs 75,855 crore gain in the market capitalisation of three top Indian firms. While Reliance Industries and Larsen & Toubro saw significant drops, Infosys's boosted guidance offered a positive outlook for IT stocks. The top ten companies' rankings remained unchanged.

title: Lloyd calls Tendulkar live after Waugh leaves him out of all-time XI ‚Äî Watch
content: A humorous podcast moment saw Sachin Tendulkar unexpectedly left out of an all-time XI by Mark Waugh. A live call to Tendulkar, introduced as 'Bumble' by David Lloyd, was abruptly cut off, eliciting laughter. The article highlights Tendulkar's unparalleled record, with Virat Kohli the closest active challenger, still significantly behind in runs and centuries.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Steelers nation demands change after Tomlin's steelers exit
content: Steelers Nation has accepted Mike Tomlin's departure after nearly two decades, with a poll showing 64.79% of fans believing it was the right decision. While acknowledging his past success and Super Bowl title, fans expressed frustration with recent playoff disappointments and conservative play-calling. Tomlin is reportedly considering a move to television.

title: Stephen Curry pens 'keep shooting' for Klay Thompson's 3-point mark
content: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: When menopause hits: How symptoms spill into work, home and relationships
content: Societal conditioning often diminishes women's worth as they age, clashing with the biological realities of perimenopause and menopause. This transition brings profound physical, cognitive, and emotional shifts, yet women are frequently dismissed and unprepared for these changes. Understanding and addressing these symptoms with medical and lifestyle support is crucial for navigating this life stage with dignity and reclaiming autonomy.

title: 'BJP people's 1st choice': PM Modi hails major BMC win; hits out at Congress in Assam
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the BJP's continuous rise, highlighting recent electoral successes in Bihar and Mumbai's BMC elections, where the party secured a historic mandate. He also laid the foundation stone for the Kaziranga Elevated Corridor in Assam, aimed at enhancing wildlife safety and boosting ecotourism. ‚ÄãPM Modi's remark comes days after BJP pulled off a massive victory in Mumbai's BMC elections, wresting power from the ally-turned-rival Uddhav Thackeray.

title: NCERT cracks down on textbook piracy, seizes 32,000 fake books in major Delhi‚ÄìNCR raid
content: A major crackdown on textbook piracy occurred in Ghaziabad. NCERT and Delhi Police seized approximately 32,000 pirated NCERT textbooks. The operation uncovered a large-scale illegal printing facility. This action follows an earlier FIR regarding copyright violations. NCERT officials provided technical assistance during the raid. The council warns that pirated books harm students and the education system.

title: Can Miami become the latest team to lift the national title on 'home' field?
content: this year marks the ninth national championship of the BCS and playoff eras . a team playing a national championship game at its home stadium is unprecedented in FBS history . one of the competing squads will be from the same state as the title .

title: Carson Beck the runner? The Miami QB is finally using his feet
content: Carson Beck hasn't run a 40-yard dash in years, but it hardly qualifies him as slow . he showcased his wheels on a 3-yard scramble into the end zone to secure a trip to the college football playoff national championship . safety Jakobe Thomas appeared to be the originator, dubbing Beck as the Miami's version of Michael Vick .

title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days
content: the league's three-week sprint to the Feb. 5 trade deadline is here . many contenders are still deciding on a direction . a weekly trip around the Association focuses on those teams trying to add to their rosters .

title: VAR review: Should Man United's Dalot have received a red card for foul on Doku?
content: Mikel Arteta questions the decision not to award a late penalty in their goalless draw with Nottingham Forest . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the premier league . we take a look at the major incidents to examine and explain the process .

title: How Davante Adams broke through in L.A. after failing to do so with Raiders, Jets
content: davante Adams signed a two-year, $44 million contract in march . he has a $28 million cap number in 2026 . the Rams head coach's message was clear . it didn't take long for Adams to realize that playing for him was where he needed to be .

content: deMeco Ryans' first season as coach of the Houston Texans was interrupted by a fan in a grocery store . he was drawn back by the success and renewed energy the former linebacker had brought to texans football . the fan said he had started watching football again, but he couldn't stomach the losing .

title: Seahawks start fast and roll past 49ers, advance to NFC Championship Game
content: the Seahawks return the opening kickoff for a touchdown and never look back in a rout of the 49ers in the divisional round . coach Mike Macdonald's team now has an even stronger claim as the most complete team in this season's playoffs . the team's top-rated special teams got it started with Rashid Shaheed returning the kickoff 95 yards .

content: temperatures could drop to single digits for divisional round game between los Angeles Rams and the Chicago Bears . if 2 degrees is where we end up, the Rams-Bears still won't be among the top five coldest playoff games . the 1967 NFL championship reigns supreme as the coldest postseason game .

title: Points league rankings: Young and Davis slide, Sabonis returns
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . the team announced this week that Young's knee and quadriceps injuries would keep him out for at least the next month, if not longer . this news dropped Young to the bottom of the top-60 in points league rankings .

content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: three years, $126 million with opt-outs after first two seasons Grade: B- The new york Mets have a new heart .

title: 'Truth of India': Mufti responds to Rahman's 'communal' remark; shares 'realities of Indian Muslims'
content: NEW DELHI: The former chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir, Mehbooba Mufti, responded to AR Rahman's "communal" remark, stating that it is the "truth of India." Music composer AR Rahman, in a BBC Asian Network interview, had stated that he has been getting less work in the industry, and he feels it is a "communal thing. " In a post on X, Mehbooba Mufti wrote, "Bollywood has always been a living mini India, mirroring the country‚Äôs social realities. Brushing aside such experiences does not change the truth about today‚Äôs India."
